overview:
## Overview

In Swift, this type bridges to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/IndexSet]; use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] class represents a mutable collection of unique unsigned integers, known as *indexes* because of the way they are used. This collection is referred to as a *mutable index set*. The inclusive range of valid indexes is `0...(NSNotFound - 1)`; trying to use indexes outside this range is invalid.

The values in a mutable index set are always sorted, so the order in which values are added is irrelevant.

Do not subclass the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] class.

# NSMutableIndexSet

**Class**

A mutable collection of unique integer values that represent indexes in another collection.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSMutableIndexSet
```

## Overview

In Swift, this type bridges to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/IndexSet]; use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] class represents a mutable collection of unique unsigned integers, known as *indexes* because of the way they are used. This collection is referred to as a *mutable index set*. The inclusive range of valid indexes is `0...(NSNotFound - 1)`; trying to use indexes outside this range is invalid.

The values in a mutable index set are always sorted, so the order in which values are added is irrelevant.

Do not subclass the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableIndexSet] class.



## Adding Indexes

- **add(_:)**: Adds an index  to the receiver.
- **add(_:)**: Adds the indexes in an index set to the receiver.
- **add(in:)**: Adds the indexes in an index range to the receiver.

## Removing Indexes

- **remove(_:)**: Removes an index from the receiver.
- **remove(_:)**: Removes the indexes in an index set from the receiver.
- **removeAllIndexes()**: Removes the receiver’s indexes.
- **remove(in:)**: Removes the indexes in an index range from the receiver.

## Shifting Index Groups

- **shiftIndexesStarting(at:by:)**: Shifts a group of indexes to the left or the right within the receiver.

## Inherits From

- NSIndexSet

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSMutableCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- Sequence
